items: Stand facing a cable machine with a shoulder-width stance.
Place the balls of your feet on a block or step, with your heels hanging off the edge.
Grasp the cable handles and lift them up to shoulder height.
Keep your arms straight and your core engaged.
Raise your heels as high as possible, squeezing your calf muscles at the top of the movement.
Lower your heels back down to the starting position, keeping tension on your calves throughout the exercise.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.

content.title: Cable Standing Calf Raise Form & Visual

items: Targets the calf muscles, specifically the gastrocnemius and soleus
Helps to improve ankle stability and balance
Can be easily adjusted to increase or decrease resistance
Allows for a full range of motion, ensuring maximum muscle activation
Can be performed with a variety of foot positions to target different areas of the calf muscles
Can be done with minimal equipment, making it a convenient exercise to do at home or at the gym

content.title: Cable Standing Calf Raise Muscles Worked

items: Gastrocnemius
Soleus
